definition: mistaken/erroneous/contradictory
dusk/evening/Taiwan pr. [xi4]
component in Chinese characters, mirror image of 夂[zhi3]
full of trouble and misfortune (usu. referring to sb's life)
to meet with many difficulties in one's life (idiom)
full of trouble and misfortune (usu. referring to someone's life)

sentences.english: There seems to always something wrong with this computer.
sentences.chinese: 來時這臺電腦近似出舛訛了。

sentences.english: The fate of capitalist production relations in China is tortuous.
sentences.chinese: 資本主義生產關係在中國的命運是多舛的。

sentences.english: Don't misinform your doctor nor your lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 別向醫生和律師提供舛訛的新聞。

sentences.english: You always make mistakes, so I can't send you there alone.
sentences.chinese: 你行事多乖舛，我不能派你一個人去。

sentences.english: Such a small mistake is pardonable.
sentences.chinese: 不會追究犯了那麼小的舛訛的。

sentences.english: The contradiction between your behavior and words makes me doubt the authenticity of this matter.
sentences.chinese: 你乖舛的言行不能不讓我懷疑事情的真實性。

sentences.english: It is quite common for youngsters to make such kind of mistake.
sentences.chinese: 小孩犯這種舛訛是較爲罕見的。

definition: the course of one's life/one's fate
to meet with many difficulties in one's life (idiom)
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
to be born under an unlucky star (usu. of women)/to be born unlucky
destitute/difficulty/hardship/trouble
to bewail/to sigh mournfully/to lament
to have a tough life/to meet much adversity in one's life
(literary) to slip/(of looks etc) to fade away/(of time) to slip away/to squander (time, opportunities)/to dillydally
difficult/hard/hardship
to have bad luck/dammit!
to sigh in regret or pity/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
bleak/miserable
forlorn/miserable
to wring one's hands (literally wring one's wrists)
half a lifetime
bad times, adverse fate (idiom)
